title: What Does Smokeshow Mean? Plus, How to Use It

steps.title: “Smokeshow” is a slang term that means someone is attractive.
steps.content: “Smokeshow” is a slang term that means someone is attractive. When you hear someone call another person a “smokeshow,” they’re saying that they’re a 10/10 on the attractiveness scale and ooze sex appeal. Basically, saying that someone is a smokeshow means they’re so physically attractive, imaginary smoke is coming off of them! [1] X Research source “Jasmine is a total smokeshow. She’s so hot, I have to get her number.” “Luis is the hottest guy I’ve ever seen. What a smokeshow.” While it’s more common to describe a woman as a “smokeshow,” anyone of any gender can be one! “Smokeshow” is sometimes written as “smoke show.”

steps.title: Admire and flirt with your date after getting to know them.
steps.content: Admire and flirt with your date after getting to know them. When you and a new date are comfortable with each other, tell them that they’re a smokeshow so they know just how into them you are. This can be a bold and flirty way to communicate your attraction and create sexual tension in your relationship. “That shirt looks incredible on you. I’ve got to admit, you’re a smokeshow.” “I couldn’t take my eyes off you last night. You’re a smokeshow.” Note : Because “smokeshow” suggests you’re sexually attracted to someone, your date might see it as a rude or unwanted advance if you don’t know each other well.

steps.title: Compliment your romantic partner’s appearance.
steps.content: Compliment your romantic partner’s appearance. When your significant other is rocking a hot outfit or is just looking particularly sexy, tell them they’re a total smokeshow. Letting them know you like what you see can make them feel good and build physical intimacy ! “Wow, babe, you’re a smokeshow. You look so sexy in that suit.” “I can’t believe I’m with a total smokeshow. You’re a 10/10.”

steps.title: Boost your friends’ confidence when they look incredible.
steps.content: Boost your friends’ confidence when they look incredible. “Smokeshow” doesn’t always have to be romantic! If one of your pals is showing off a new outfit or hairstyle, tell them that they’re a smokeshow so they know they look good. “You’re a smokeshow with that new haircut, Maya! Everyone’s going to want your number tonight!” “Way to show us up, Jun! You’re a smokeshow in that fit.”

steps.title: Use “smokeshow” in casual and flirty situations.
steps.content: Use “smokeshow” in casual and flirty situations. “Smokeshow” is a slang term that’s used to admire someone’s physical appearance, so it’s generally considered inappropriate to say it in formal situations. Stick to using it in casual conversations with your partner, close friends, or dates instead of in the workplace or around colleagues. [2] X Research source

steps.title: “Smokeshow” is intended as a compliment, but some may find it rude.
steps.content: “Smokeshow” is intended as a compliment, but some may find it rude. Telling someone that they’re a smokeshow is usually seen as a flirty way to admire their appearance or let them know that you find them super attractive. While some people may find this term flattering, others might see it as objectifying or disrespectful because it only focuses on their looks. [3] X Research source Reflect on your relationship with the person and if they’re comfortable with compliments about their appearance before telling them they’re a smokeshow. Stick to complimenting someone’s personality or skills if you’re not sure they’re comfortable with compliments about their appearance.

steps.title: “Smokeshow” started gaining online popularity in the early 2000s.
steps.content: “Smokeshow” started gaining online popularity in the early 2000s. While “smokeshow” may have been used earlier, its first online appearance was on Urban Dictionary in 2003. The website Barstool Sports helped the term gain popularity due to their “Smokeshow of the Day” page, which featured attractive women across the United States. [4] X Research source “Smokeshow” may have been used as far back as the 1920s. It might refer to how attractive women looked when they smoked cigars, which wasn’t legal in the US at the time. [5] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source “Smokeshow” might have originated from a hockey term, which specifically describes an attractive hockey fan.

steps.title: “Bombshell,” “babe,” and “hottie” also refer to someone attractive.
steps.content: “Bombshell,” “babe,” and “hottie” also refer to someone attractive. There are lots of phrases to compliment someone’s appearance or let them know you find them attractive, like: You’re hot. You’re a bombshell. You’re such a babe. You’re a hottie. You’re smoking hot. You’re sexy. You’re a snack. You’re a dreamboat.
